description: This file defines the AppDatabase class responsible for managing the lifecycle, creation, and migration of a local SQLite database within a Flutter application. It encapsulates database opening, lazy initialization, and closing functionalities, leveraging the sqflite package, and references a schema definition in notes_schema.dart.

classes.name: AppDatabase
classes.description: Encapsulates logic for opening, migrating, and closing a local SQLite database, providing an asynchronous lazy-initialized database instance.

methods.name: database
methods.description: Returns a future resolving to an opened database instance, initializing it if necessary.

methods.name: _open
methods.description: Internal method to open the database, setting up the schema and handling potential upgrades.

methods.name: close
methods.description: Closes the database connection and resets internal references, useful for cleanup or testing.
